data.title: Elisabeth (Howard) Elliot (1926-2015)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Elisabeth (Howard) Elliot born 1926 Brussels, Belgium died 2015 Magnolia, Gloucester, Essex, Massachusetts, United States including ancestors + children + 3 photos + 2 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors

[sibling(s) unknown]

Wife of [private husband (1930s - unknown)]

Profile last modified 22 Jun 2024 | Created 7 Jan 2017

This page has been accessed 2,389 times.

Biography

Elisabeth (Howard) Elliot is Notable.

Elisabeth Howard was born 21 Dec 1926 in Brussels, Belgium, the daughter of missionaries to Belgium.[1]

"She was a Christian author and speaker. Her first husband, Jim Elliot, was killed in 1956 while attempting to make missionary contact with the Aucas (now known as Huaorani; also rendered as Waorani or Waodani) of eastern Ecuador. She later spent two years as a missionary to the tribe members who killed her husband. Returning to the United States after many years in South America, she became widely known as the author of over twenty books and as a speaker in constant demand. Elliot toured the country, sharing her knowledge and experience, well into her seventies.

Elisabeth believed in asking this foundational question: Is this God's will for me, right now, in this place? … Unapologetically, Elisabeth espoused such truths as: give to get, lose to find, and die to live. Setting her sights “on things above” (Colossians 3:1), Elisabeth ministered among three indigenous groups in Ecuador before helping listeners and readers find joy in the ordinary affairs of life—like cooking meals and cleaning toilets—on her globally syndicated radio program. She called it living sacramentally."

Elizabeth (Betty) Howard's parents were Philip Eugene Howard Jr. and Katharine Gillingham. She graduated from Wheaton College in 1948. She married first Philip James (Jim) Elliot about 1953. Children: Valerie who married Rev. Walter D Shepard Jr. They have eight children. She married second Dr. Addison Hardie Leitch in 1969 as his second wife. After his death in 1973 she married Lars L Gren on 21 Dec 1977. Elizabeth died on 15 Jun 2015 in Magnolia, Massachusetts after suffering for several years with Alzheimer's.
